abstract: House of Representatives narrowly passes bill that would remove key parts of Pres Obama's immigration policy and reverse his 2014 executive order that allowed some illegal immigrants to apply for work permits; 26 Republicans vote against bill, revealing possible breakdown of party's longtime unity on immigration issue; Senate Democrats threaten filibuster.
lead_paragraph: Some Republican members deserted their party to vote against a bill denying safeguards for undocumented immigrants, including the young known as Dreamers.

byline.contributor: Emmarie Huetteman and Michael D. Shear contributed reporting.

snippet: Some Republican members deserted their party to vote against a bill denying safeguards for undocumented immigrants, including the young known as Dreamers.

headline.main: House Measure Defies Obama on Immigrants
headline.print_headline: House Measure Defies Obama on Immigrants
